newsitem.title: FRANCE: Jospin says won't privatise France Telecom.
newsitem.headline: Jospin says won't privatise France Telecom.

text.p: French Socialist party leader Lionel Jospin on Tuesday said he did not plan to privatise France Telecom and a planned consultation of the company's staff would only be used to advise the government.
"It's not the staff of France Telecom who decide on the privatisation of a very large company. That is a decision of the state, of the public powers," Jospin told Europe 1 radio.

"Our position is not to privatise France Telecom," he added. "We are currently in a process which has started. The staff, faced with a government and a boss which wants to privatise France Telecom, will formulate an answer which is valid at a given moment," he said.
"In another situation, with an authority which reacts differently on this point, I am not sure their opinion will be the same because they know that the process is not the same," he said.
"We could very well ask (staff) their opinion, it will be an element that enters into the decision, no more," he said.
The outgoing government planned to sell a 30 to 35 percent stake in a first share offer and pledged to keep 51 percent in the telecommunications operator.
Analysts expects a government of Socialists and Communists to postpone the sale by a few months but not to cancel it altogether.
